meanings.sent1: The cat's dorse was fluffy and warm.
meanings.sent2: The horse's dorse was strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to scratch its dorse with its hind leg.
meanings.sent4: The dorse of the cow glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The bird landed on the dorse of the sheep.

meanings.definition: To endorse or sign the back of a document.
meanings.sent1: Please dorse the check before depositing it.
meanings.sent2: He dorsed the contract to finalize the deal.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the student to dorse the permission slip.
meanings.sent4: She quickly dorsed the form without reading it thoroughly.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to dorse the waiver before the competition.

meanings.definition: To support or approve of something.
meanings.sent1: I will dorse your decision to go on the trip.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to dorse the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The parents dorsed their child's choice of career.
meanings.sent4: The team captain dorsed the coach's strategy for the game.
meanings.sent5: The mayor dorsed the initiative for cleaner streets.
